decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly applying pressure on opponents by playing an aggressive game plan with small, efficient creatures and combat tricks to push through damage efficiently. The deck also makes use of some protection spells and powerful companions to ensure its creatures survive and deal damage consistently. By utilizing a mix of evasion, removal, and efficient attackers, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents before they have a chance to stabilize and win the game in the early turns.

The main focus of the deck is to quickly cast Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard using spells like Lightning Axe and Consider, while also utilizing cards like Picklock Prankster and Ledger Shredder for additional value. The deck aims to be aggressive and proactive, constantly filling the graveyard with instants and sorceries to bring back Arclight Phoenix and generate card advantage through Treasure Cruise. The use of cheap spells like Opt and Fiery Impulse allows for early game aggression, while efficient counterspells like Spell Pierce help protect key threats. Additionally, the inclusion of Temporal Trespass provides a powerful late game finisher.

This deck focuses on utilizing the combo potential of Amalia Benavides Aguirre along with cards like Aetherflux Reservoir and Chord of Calling to create a powerful life gain engine. The deck includes various creatures like Cenote Scout, Lunarch Veteran, and Wildgrowth Walker to support the combo strategy, while also incorporating cards like Collected Company and Return to the Ranks for additional utility. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistency and to support the deck's overall game plan, with lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Eiganjo, Seat of the Empire included for added versatility.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on fast, efficient aggression with creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Questing Druid, supported by spells like Play with Fire and Audacity to keep up the pressure. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional value and flexibility. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly before they have a chance to stabilize, utilizing a mix of creatures and burn spells to push through damage and secure a victory. The mana base is optimized to ensure consistent early plays and maximize the deck's aggressive potential.

The main concept of this deck is centered around quickly ramping up green mana through devotion to cast powerful green spells and creatures to overwhelm the opponent. This involves utilizing cards like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and mana dorks like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves to generate mana efficiently. Key cards include Nissa, Who Shakes the World, Storm the Festival, and creatures like Old-Growth Troll and Cavalier of Thorns to establish board presence and pressure the opponent. The goal is to establish a strong board presence and win through aggressive plays.

The key concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to aggressively pressure opponents with a combination of efficient creatures and disruption spells. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize while deploying threats like Archfiend of the Dross and Bloodtithe Harvester to quickly close out games. Using cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Bitter Triumph to generate additional value, the deck seeks to maintain a strong presence on the battlefield and force opponents to react defensively, ultimately overwhelming them with a relentless assault.

The main idea of this deck is to swarm the board with low-cost creatures and pump them up with combat tricks in order to deal a large amount of damage to the opponent quickly. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional mana acceleration and flexibility. The deck also features a mix of red and white mana sources, as well as some black lands for added versatility in casting spells. Overall, the strategy revolves around aggressive plays and leveraging the synergy between the creatures and combat tricks available.

The key theme of this deck is to utilize a variety of control elements and disruption spells to gradually deplete the opponent's resources and hand. The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Duress, and Liliana of the Veil to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also having removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to deal with threats. Additionally, cards like Waste Not and Mazemind Tome provide card advantage and help generate value. Ultimately, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and control the game until victory.
